title: Possible Yasuo bug
body: Yasuo's Windwall was blocking Viktor E's, and blocked a Lux laser as well. Last I heard it only blocked projectiles. If this is a bug, it could have a major impact on ranked games, and should be addressed quickly. If not, I must have missed that patch note

replies.body:
Hey EliteGuard, 

actually Viktor's E and Lux's Q, W and E are all missiles which is why Yasuo's wall can block them.

I didn't know Lux's laser was on her Q, W, or E.

But yes, Viktor's laser is blocked, Lux's laser is not.

No, it doesn't make any sense.
Viktor laser (his E) doesn't really give the idea of a projectile.

> [{quoted}](name=Stars Shaper,realm=EUW,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=ElFpz8VU,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2015-06-25T17:59:55.957+0000)
>
> Viktor laser (his E) doesn't really give the idea of a projectile.


It's a projectile that travels at the ground height. The part that connects the projectile to Viktor's staff is a visual effect. Generally when you have an ability that deals damage along the path that it's traveling, rather than damaging a big area all at once, it's a missile.

Some clarity would be appreciated regarding Yasou's blocking ability of lasers etc. a lot of things are really confusing and seems to make no sense.

Regarding Viktor's E it's the only laser in the game that is blocked by the Wind wall. Visually it's a laser, dealing damage at its end point and having a beam in between its attacker and target, just like Vel'koz aa for example.

Rumble's entire ult disappear if Yasou Wind wall, while Ziggs ult works, so multiple bombs raining from the sky is blocked by a vertical wall while one bomb isn't.

Both of these are due to how ground target travel is coded as you described above, but in my opinion it adds more confusion and frustration than actual game interaction. Exclusions in coding where added to champions such as Ziggs and Vel'koz mentioned above, why not other laser users and "from above" attacks?

The tldr is that height doesn't matter when it comes to missiles getting destroyed by Yasuo's wall (or Braum's sheild, the two abilities are using common tech). That's why missiles that travel on ground height and missiles that travel over the wall will in most cases get destroyed.

It's possible to make a missile that doesn't get destroyed by Yasuo's wall/ Braum's shield and at that point it's a design decision. I can't speak to the design decisions on the missiles you mentioned as I don't do anything related to design.

I know there's no Y-axis in the engine. This is more about visual clarity. 

Ziggs got a coding exception due to his ult visually looking like it comes from above, Vel'koz got an exception for his aa due to them visually looking like lasers (similarly to how Thresh is a long ranged melee aa and also an exception).

What's important as a player often isn't the mechanics behind the scenes but that it feels right to the visual feedback the game gives. Viktor's laser and Rumbles ultimate in my opinion (and it seems others) fails this, they give you a visual expectation of how they should interact that fails to deliver.

If it's possible it would be great if the feedback provided in this thread could be forwarded to the relevant design team to consider.

If is not a creature (minion/champion or the sorts), but has a projectile and travel speed, it's a projectile that'll be blocked by wind wall/unbreakable.

Do note, Nautilus does not have a projectile. It just spawns a knock-up area every now and then.

Ziggs ult doesn't have a projectile, Vel ult doesn't, nor does Lux ult. None of these three abilities will be blocked by wind wall. These are abilities that designate an area and then damage that area without projectile.

Ziggs ult actually is a projectile it was just added as an exception to how Wind wall works after community feedback (due to, as in this discussion, it made no sense that it was blocked).

video of at release interaction: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AeG6kPPHwq8#t=420 (Ziggs interaction start at 7:00)
